page.title: 10MORE JOBS FOR A HILL FARMER
page.content: On my morning inspection of my upland farm near Hownam,in Scotland,I had found that the cows had broken a fence so I loaded a trailer with stobs and fencing tools,and was on my way to do the repairs,when a travelling sales- man arrived.I did not need the worm drench he offered, so his visit was short,and I got on with the fencing.I had an hour off at lunch time,and then went out to bale hay. This was soon interupted when a calving cow needed some assistance. After my tea I built the bales into stacks of 8, and put a plastic bag on top, to keep any rain from soaking down through. The goats were now waiting to be milked,the lambs to be fed, and the dogs fed and shut up for the night.Now I could sink into a chair,and if no emergency arose doze until supper time, and then off to bed till 6.45a,m. next morning.
